trips.title: RIB-Boat Whale and Island Safari
trips.description:
We start with a safety instruction and the distribution of warm overalls and life jackets which you will have to wear on board. It is important to wear warm footwear and even mittens, it gets cold once out on the sea.
Then it’s time to sail into Ísafjarðardjúp, the stunning fjord region just off Ísafjörður. We are heading to the island Vigur which, during the summer, has a large population of puffins, eider ducks and other seabirds. The locals will greet you with warm and light refreshments. You’ll have the chance to walk around the island and enjoy the beautiful landscape that surrounds the island.
When you’ve stayed on the island for a while, it’s time to step on the boat again and do some whale watching. The chances are high that you’ll go close to whales that really like to show off. You might also see puffins and other sea birds having a swim and of course the beautiful landscape.
Don’t forget you camera!
 
Please note that the sailing route and duration can change due to wheather conditions, each tour is unique.
trips.excerpt: Experience Ísafjarðardjúp bay in all it’s glory. This 4 hour exciting safari tours offers you magnificent views over the landscape from the sea and visit to the island Vigur. This is an experience that's difficult to forget!
trips.included: boat tour, warm overalls, life jacket, guidance and light refreshments in Vigur Island

trips.title: History at Hesteyri
trips.description: We offer you a guided day tour to the abounded village of Hesteyri. The village is only to be reached by boat and the boat ride from Ísafjörður takes about 70 minutes.  Luring in one of the renown Glacier Fjords (Jökulfirðir), Hesteyri has a beautiful scenery and rich history.  In the late 1940’s, the people of the village Hesteyri, made a common decision to move away, and in 1952 the village stood totally abandoned. Upon arrival at Hesteyri the guide will take you for a walk around the village, you´ll get an insight of the history and a feeling of how it was to live almost on the edge of the earth. It is also a great way to enjoy the pure, colorful nature of this area popular with hikers. The walk ends in the old Doctor´s house where you´ll be served traditional Icelandic refreshments. If lucky you´ll get a chance to see seals, arctic foxes or a whale on this tour.
trips.excerpt: A guided walk at the abounded village of Hesteyri in Hornstrandir.

customFields.value:
Please pick up your tickets at Vesturferðir Office.

Meeting point for the tour is 30 minutes before departure. Tour operator is Sjóferðir.

trips.requirements:
Dress according to weather.

Water proofed jacket, sturdy shoes, warm hat and gloves are recommended.
trips.attention: Not suitable for physically disabled nor for wheelchairs as it includes a walk on uneven paths.

pricingCategories.title: A day's hike in the Nature Reserve

trips.title: RIB-boat Ocean Safari
trips.description:
2 hours sightseeing safari tour from Ísafjörður town which offers a magnificent view over the surrounding landscape from the sea side.   

We start with a safety instruction and the distribution of warm overalls and life jackets which you will have to wear onboard. It is important to wear warm footwear and even mittens, it gets cold once out on the sea. This tour will take you into Ísafjarðardjúp, the stunning fjord region just off Ísafjörður. We pass the beautiful bird island Vigur or Snæfjallaströnd (Snow-Mountain-Coast) chances are high that you’ll see different kinds of birds such as puffins flying around and seals and probably even whales swimming across the sailing route. Time for photo shooting is included.

Depending on weather conditions the route differs and will in each case be an unique adventure.
trips.included: boat tour, overall, life jacket and guidance

trips.title: A day's hike in the Nature Reserve
trips.description:
Due to the harshness of the environment, the Hornstrandir area was abandoned completely by the last of its inhabitants in the early 1950’s. Since 1974 the flora and fauna has been protected and now arctic foxes, birds, seals and plants have thrived undisturbed.

You´ll leave by boat from Ísafjörður in the morning for the abandoned village of Sæból in Aðalvík. Continuing on foot to another abandoned settlement at Hesteyri, we pass the old church and parsonage at Staður. Crossing the mountain, enjoy a spectacular and panoramic view across Ísafjarðardjúp bay and Jökulfirðir (Glacier fjords) to Drangajökull glacier. Returning by boat from Hesteyri in the evening.
 
A moderate hike for people in good shape. Hiking distance is about 14 km on rough ground and elevation is of about 300 m.
 
Additionally you can order a fresh and homemade lunch package consisting of two bread buns, a power bar and a muffin for 2.100 ISK each.
trips.excerpt: A moderate hike for people in good shape. Hiking distance is about 14 km on rough ground and elevation is of about 300 m.
trips.requirements: Participation in this tour requires warm and wind/waterproof clothes, solid hiking boots, gloves and cap, a lunch pack and something to drink! Wading shoes are optional, but it would be a good idea to bring a small towel to dry your feet after being in the water. And don't forget to bring your camera.

trips.title: The Prime Hiking Destination
trips.description:
Due to the harsh nature and remoteness the Hornstrandir area was abandoned completely by the last of its inhabitants in the early 1950’s. Since 1974 the flora and fauna has been protected and now arctic foxes, birds, seals and plants have thrived undisturbed.

On this hike the guide leads you through the singular history of the area and the unspoiled nature; untouched by cars, electricity or domestic animals. The boat leaves Ísafjörður in the morning for the abandoned village of Hesteyri. Continuing on foot between the creeks and bays to another abandoned settlement at Látrar, we pass the ruins of the old farm Neðri-Miðvík and, crossing the mountain, enjoy a spectacular and panoramic view across Aðalvík bay and Straumnes mountain. Returning by boat from Látrar in Aðalvík bay in the evening.
 
This is a hike for people in a good shape. Hiking distance is about 12 km on rough ground and elevation is of about 300 meters.
 
Additionally you can order a fresh and homemade lunch package consisting of two bread buns, a power bar and a muffin for 2.100 ISK each.
trips.requirements: Participation in this tour requires warm and wind/waterproof clothes, solid hiking boots, gloves and cap, a lunch pack and something to drink! Wading shoes are optional but a small towel could be nice to dry feet after the wading. And don't forget to bring your camera.

trips.title: King and Queen of cliffs
trips.description:
Hornvík is without a doubt one of the most beautiful places in Iceland. It is surrounded by two of the three largest bird cliffs in Europe, has a mystic remoteness and magnificent cliffs. When millions of birds shout as loud as they can, one forgets the noise of the traffic and normal life. It is as far away as it can be and the term silence gets a new meaning.

Before stepping onto dry land the boat stops for a moment to view the cliffs of Hælavíkurbjarg, a cliff that reaches almost vertically an altitude of 4-500 meters. Stepping ashore on the other side of the bay, you hike up to the top of Hornbjarg cliff (537 meters). The arctic foxes are nearby and might appear without notice. The tour takes about 10-12 hours, the stay in Hornvík is around 6-7 hours, spent walking and enjoying all the magnificent things that catch your eyes.
This hike is for people in moderate shape. The hiking distance is about 6 km on rough and on parts steep grounds.
Additionally you can order a fresh and homemade lunch package consisting of two bread buns, a power bar and a muffin for 2.100 ISK each.
trips.excerpt: Hornvík is without a doubt one of the most beautiful places in Iceland. It is surrounded by two of the three largest bird cliffs in Europe, has a mystic remoteness and magnificent cliffs. When millions of birds shout as loud as they can, one forgets the n
trips.requirements: Participation in this tour requires warm and wind/waterproof clothes, solid hiking boots, gloves and cap, a lunch pack and something to drink. And don't forget to bring your camera!

trips.title: Vigur - Paradise Island
trips.description:
There is always something charming about small islands, and the harmony of thousands of birds in Vigur completes the beautiful landscape. Over the years, the island Vigur has earned itself a great reputation and is therefore a must on any itinerary. Its five friendly inhabitants welcome you with their relaxed easy manner and somehow, one feels that time stands still in Vigur.

After a half an hour boat ride from Ísafjörður, you take a leisurely walk around the island. It´s a perfect opportunity to see the abundance of birds in their natural environment. The island is a home for thousands of birds e.g. eider ducks, arctic terns, puffins, black guillemot and more. The only windmill in Iceland is located in Vigur. Refreshments are served by the farmer’s family.

Prior to heading back, you can visit the smallest post office in Europe and send home a card or two. The tour takes approximately 3 hours.
trips.included: boat tour, guidance, light refreshments at the island.
trips.attention: Not suitable for physically disabled nor for wheelchairs as it includes a walk on uneven paths.
